wikipedia_page.main: Robert Mason (17 December 1857 – 1 August 1927) was a British Liberal Party politician.

response: *Robert Mason (Liberal politician) was born in Belford in 1857 and was a member of parliament from 1918 to 1922

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1918 United Kingdom general election

response: * Robert Mason (died by 1581), MP for Ludlow
* Robert Mason (died 1635) (1579–1635), Member of Parliament for Winchester, 1628, and Christchurch, 1626
* Robert Mason (died c. 1669) (c. 1626–c. 1669), Member of Parliament for Winchester, 1666–1669
* Robert Mason (Liberal politician) (1857–1927), Member of Parliament for Wansbeck 1918–1922
*Robert Mason, lead singer for the bands Lynch Mob and Warrant

Edwards continued working as a miner during World War I.  A supporter of Robert Smillie, he opposed the war.  He narrowly missed election to Parliament at the 1918 Wansbeck by-election, standing as a local Labour Party candidate, losing to Robert Mason.  He lost in Wansbeck again at the 1918 general election.

Wansbeck Liberal Association adopted Alderman Robert Mason as their candidate to replace Fenwick.The Times, 13 May 1918 p6 Mason was a 60-year-old shipping agent and shipowner The Times, 22 May 1918 p3 with local government and community connections. He was an Alderman of Northumberland County Council and a Justice of the Peace.Who was Who, OUP 2007
